title: Gloria Dei Church National Historic Site: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           916 S. Swanson Street  Philadelphia, PA 19147                 Directions         The Gloria Dei Church is accessed from Christian Street in South Philadelphia. As in any city, use your street smarts and do not leave any valuables visible in your car. Several SEPTA bus routes serve the vicinity of the site.  Visit the website for more information.    Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Gloria Dei Church hours Gloria Dei is an active religious congregation, and home to the parish minister. Religious services are held on Sundays at 10am.  Regular operating hours are Tuesday through Sunday from 9am to 4pm, except during services.    Standard Hours    Sunday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Monday: Closed   Tuesday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Wednesday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Thursday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Friday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM   Saturday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM             Weather           Summers are typically hot and muggy, fall and spring are generally mild, and winter is cold. Snowfall is highly variable, with some winters bringing only light snow and others bringing several major snowstorms, with the normal seasonal snowfall standing at 22.4 in (57 cm). Precipitation is generally spread throughout the year, with eight to twelve wet days per month.         Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Gloria Dei Church fee - $0.00 There is no fee to enter the site, and reservations are not required. However, you may wish to confirm visiting hours prior to your arrival by contacting the rector at 215-389-1513.          Visitor Centers                   The site includes the historic church and surrounding cemetery. NPS photo       The Gloria Dei Church National Historic Site is located at 916 S. Swanson Street in South Philadelphia. It sits near the Delaware River between the Benjamin Franklin and Walt Whitman bridges, approximately 1.5 miles from the Independence Visitor Center in the Historic District. See this area map. Many visitors to the site find it easiest to arrive by motor vehicle. Read more about the directions. Gloria Dei is an active religious congregation, and home to the parish minister. Religious services are held on Sundays at 10am. Please visit the church's website for more information about services.   Regular operating hours are Tuesday through Sunday from 9am to 4pm, except during services. There is no fee to enter the site, and reservations are not required. However, you may wish to confirm visiting hours prior to your arrival by contacting the rector at 215-389-1513. Those visitors wishing to obtain a National Park Passport stamp should call ahead to ensure the rector will be in the church office located in the Roak House. The site has limited accessibility. The sanctuary is fully accessible for those with mobility challenges, but the cemetery is not accessible. There are no accessible restrooms located at the site.
